page.title: 13Dairy Farming Cont
page.content: the milk once a day at 9am and takes it to the local Quinneys dairy where it is bottled ready for sale. A small amount is made into cream. The jobs on the farm are closely linked to the rearing of dariy cow's and the growing of hay to feed them. The cows graze in the fields in the summer but in the winter the cows stay in the barns and farm yards. The main summer jobs include feeding the calbes, milking and cleaning out the milking parlour and farmyard. Haymaking starts in late summer. In the winter the jobs are restricted to hedging and general repairs to the fences and gates.
